answers.answer: You didn't state what sex you are and what coronary artery risk factors you have (Diabetes, HTN, high cholesterol, age, male sex, family history, smoking), but regardless, your profile looks decent.  You LDL is at goal, your HDL is very close to goal, typically we like it to be 55 or greater, your TG 'sare not at goal.  The goal is less than 150.  This can be easily accomplished by limiting your CARBOHYDRATE intake (pasta, breads, empty calories from sodas, candy, etc) and exercising.  Omega 3 fish oil has been shown to deceased TG's as well.  You can get it from eating fish or from taking a supplement.

question: I recently had blood work done could you please tell me where i stand with my results,Triglycerides 198,Cholesterol 191,dHDL Cholesterol 51,LDL 100, VLDL 40, Chol/HDLC 5.46
title: understanding blood test results
